member.summary: Gets the consumer key.

member.summary: The messaging channel for OAuth 1.0(a) Consumers.
Initializes a new instance of the class.

The web application store to use for nonces.
The token manager instance to use.
The security settings.
The message factory.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.OAuthConsumerChannel.GetConsumerSecret(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the consumer secret for a given consumer key.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.OAuthConsumerChannel.InitializeBindingElements(DotNetOpenAuth.Messaging.ITamperProtectionChannelBindingElement,DotNetOpenAuth.Messaging.Bindings.INonceStore)
member.summary: Initializes the binding elements for the OAuth channel.

The nonce store.

member.name: T:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.OAuthConsumerMessageFactory
member.summary: An OAuth-protocol specific implementation of the interface.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.OAuthConsumerMessageFactory.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.OAuthConsumerMessageFactory.GetNewRequestMessage(DotNetOpenAuth.Messaging.MessageReceivingEndpoint,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Analyzes an incoming request message payload to discover what kind of message is embedded in it and returns the type, or null if no match is found.
member.param: The intended or actual recipient of the request message.
The name/value pairs that make up the message payload.
member.returns: A newly instantiated -derived object that this message can deserialize to. Null if the request isn't recognized as a valid protocol message.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.OAuthConsumerMessageFactory.GetNewResponseMessage(DotNetOpenAuth.Messaging.IDirectedProtocolMessage,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Analyzes an incoming request message payload to discover what kind of message is embedded in it and returns the type, or null if no match is found.
member.param: The message that was sent as a request that resulted in the response. Null on a Consumer site that is receiving an indirect message from the Service Provider.
The name/value pairs that make up the message payload.
member.returns: A newly instantiated -derived object that this message can deserialize to. Null if the request isn't recognized as a valid protocol message.
member.remarks: The response messages are: UnauthorizedTokenResponse AuthorizedTokenResponse

member.name: T:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.RsaSha1ConsumerSigningBindingElement

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Determines whether the signature on some message is valid.
member.param: The message to check the signature on.
member.returns: true if the signature on the message is valid; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Calculates a signature for a given message.
member.param: The message to sign.
member.remarks: This method signs the message per OAuth 1.0 section 9.3.

member.summary: Creates a new object that is a copy of the current instance.

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.RsaSha1ConsumerSigningBindingElement.SigningCertificate

member.name: T:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ConsumerBase
member.summary: Base class for and types.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The endpoints and behavior of the Service Provider.
The host's method of storing and recalling tokens and secrets.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ConsumerBase.RequestNewClientAccount(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Obtains an access token for a new account at the Service Provider via 2-legged OAuth.
member.param: Any applicable parameters to include in the query string of the token request.
member.remarks: The token secret is stored in the .

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ConsumerBase.CreateAuthorizingHandler(System.String,System.Net.Http.HttpMessageHandler)
member.summary: Creates an HTTP handler that automatically applies an OAuth 1 access token and signature to outbound HTTP requests. The result of this method can be supplied to the constructor.
member.param: The access token to use to authorize each outbound HTTP message.
The inner HTTP handler to use. The default uses as the inner handler.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ConsumerBase.PrepareAuthorizedRequest(DotNetOpenAuth.Messaging.MessageReceivingEndpoint,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a web request prepared with OAuth authorization that may be further tailored by adding parameters by the caller.
member.param: The URL and method on the Service Provider to send the request to.
The access token that permits access to the protected resource.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ConsumerBase.PrepareAuthorizedRequest(DotNetOpenAuth.Messaging.MessageReceivingEndpoint,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Creates a web request prepared with OAuth authorization that may be further tailored by adding parameters by the caller.
member.param: The URL and method on the Service Provider to send the request to.
The access token that permits access to the protected resource.
Extra parameters to include in the message. Must not be null, but may be empty.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ConsumerBase.PrepareAuthorizedRequest(DotNetOpenAuth.Messaging.MessageReceivingEndpoint,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{DotNetOpenAuth.Messaging.MultipartPostPart})
member.summary: Prepares an authorized request that carries an HTTP multi-part POST, allowing for binary data.
member.param: The URL and method on the Service Provider to send the request to.
The access token that permits access to the protected resource.
Extra parameters to include in the message. Must not be null, but may be empty.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ConsumerBase.PrepareAuthorizedRequest(DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.Messages.AccessProtectedResourceRequest)
member.summary: Prepares an HTTP request that has OAuth authorization already attached to it.
member.param: The OAuth authorization message to attach to the HTTP request.
member.returns: The HttpWebRequest that can be used to send the HTTP request to the remote service provider.
member.remarks: If property on the has the flag set and is set to an HTTP method that includes an entity body, the request stream is automatically sent if and only if the dictionary is non-empty.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ConsumerBase.PrepareAuthorizedRequestAndSend(DotNetOpenAuth.Messaging.MessageReceivingEndpoint,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a web request prepared with OAuth authorization that may be further tailored by adding parameters by the caller.
member.param: The URL and method on the Service Provider to send the request to.
The access token that permits access to the protected resource.
member.exception: Thrown if the request fails for any reason after it is sent to the Service Provider.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ConsumerBase.Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ConsumerBase.CreateAuthorizingMessage(DotNetOpenAuth.Messaging.MessageReceivingEndpoint,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a web request prepared with OAuth authorization that may be further tailored by adding parameters by the caller.
member.param: The URL and method on the Service Provider to send the request to.
The access token that permits access to the protected resource.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ConsumerBase.PrepareRequestUserAuthorization(System.Uri,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String},System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String},System.String@)
member.summary: Prepares an OAuth message that begins an authorization request that will redirect the user to the Service Provider to provide that authorization.
member.param: An optional Consumer URL that the Service Provider should redirect the User Agent to upon successful authorization.
Extra parameters to add to the request token message. Optional.
Extra parameters to add to the redirect to Service Provider message. Optional.
The request token that must be exchanged for an access token after the user has provided authorization.
member.returns: The pending user agent redirect based message to be sent as an HttpResponse.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ConsumerBase.ProcessUserAuthorization(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Exchanges a given request token for access token.
member.param: The request token that the user has authorized.
The verifier code.
member.returns: The access token assigned by the Service Provider.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ConsumerBase.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases unmanaged and - optionally - managed resources
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.summary: Gets the Consumer Key used to communicate with the Service Provider.

member.summary: Gets the Service Provider that will be accessed.

member.summary: Gets or sets the channel to use for sending/receiving messages.

member.name: T:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.DesktopConsumer
member.summary: Used by a desktop application to use OAuth to access the Service Provider on behalf of the User.
member.remarks: The methods on this class are thread-safe. Provided the properties are set and not changed afterward, a single instance of this class may be used by an entire desktop application safely.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.DesktopConsumer.#ctor(DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ServiceProviderDescription,DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.IConsumerTokenManager)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The endpoints and behavior of the Service Provider.
The host's method of storing and recalling tokens and secrets.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.DesktopConsumer.RequestUserAuthorization(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String},System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String},System.String@)
member.summary: Begins an OAuth authorization request.
member.param: Extra parameters to add to the request token message. Optional.
Extra parameters to add to the redirect to Service Provider message. Optional.
The request token that must be exchanged for an access token after the user has provided authorization.
member.returns: The URL to open a browser window to allow the user to provide authorization.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.DesktopConsumer.ProcessUserAuthorization(System.String)
member.summary: Exchanges a given request token for access token.
member.param: The request token that the user has authorized.
member.returns: The access token assigned by the Service Provider.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.DesktopConsumer.ProcessUserAuthorization(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Exchanges a given request token for access token.
member.param: The request token that the user has authorized.
The verifier code typed in by the user. Must not be Null for OAuth 1.0a service providers and later.
member.returns: The access token assigned by the Service Provider.

member.summary: A delegating HTTP handler that signs outgoing HTTP requests with an HMAC-SHA1 signature.

member.name: T:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.OAuth1HttpMessageHandlerBase
member.summary: A base class for delegating s that sign outgoing HTTP requests per the OAuth 1.0 "3.4 Signature" in RFC 5849.

member.summary: These are the characters that may be chosen from when forming a random nonce.

member.summary: The default parameters location.

member.summary: An array containing simply the amperstand character.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The inner handler which is responsible for processing the HTTP response messages.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.OAuth1HttpMessageHandlerBase.ApplyAuthorization(System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage)
member.summary: Applies OAuth authorization to the specified request. This method is applied automatically to outbound requests that use this message handler instance. However this method may be useful for obtaining the OAuth 1.0 signature without actually sending the request.
member.param: The request.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.OAuth1HttpMessageHandlerBase.SendAsync(System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Sends an HTTP request to the inner handler to send to the server as an asynchronous operation.
member.param: The HTTP request message to send to the server.
A cancellation token to cancel operation.
member.returns: Returns . The task object representing the asynchronous operation.

member.summary: Calculates the signature for the specified buffer.

member.summary: Gets the OAuth 1.0 signature to apply to the specified request.
member.param: The outbound HTTP request.
The oauth parameters.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.OAuth1HttpMessageHandlerBase.GetConsumerAndTokenSecretString
member.summary: Gets the "ConsumerSecret&AccessTokenSecret" string, allowing either property to be empty or null.
member.remarks: This is useful in the PLAINTEXT and HMAC-SHA1 signature algorithms.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.OAuth1HttpMessageHandlerBase.UrlEscape(System.String)
member.summary: Escapes a value for transport in a URI, per RFC 3986.
member.param: The value to escape. Null and empty strings are OK.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.OAuth1HttpMessageHandlerBase.ToTimeStamp(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Returns the OAuth 1.0 timestamp for the current time.
member.param: The date time.
member.returns: A string representation of the number of seconds since "the epoch".

member.param: The request URI.
member.returns: The string to include in the signature base string.

member.param: The HTTP request message.

member.name: T:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.WebConsumer
member.summary: A website or application that uses OAuth to access the Service Provider on behalf of the User.
member.remarks: The methods on this class are thread-safe. Provided the properties are set and not changed afterward, a single instance of this class may be used by an entire web application safely.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.WebConsumer.#ctor(DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ServiceProviderDescription,DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.IConsumerTokenManager)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The endpoints and behavior of the Service Provider.
The host's method of storing and recalling tokens and secrets.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.WebConsumer.PrepareRequestUserAuthorization
member.summary: Begins an OAuth authorization request and redirects the user to the Service Provider to provide that authorization. Upon successful authorization, the user is redirected back to the current page.
member.returns: The pending user agent redirect based message to be sent as an HttpResponse.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.WebConsumer.PrepareRequestUserAuthorization(System.Uri,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String},System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Prepares an OAuth message that begins an authorization request that will redirect the user to the Service Provider to provide that authorization.
member.param: An optional Consumer URL that the Service Provider should redirect the User Agent to upon successful authorization.
Extra parameters to add to the request token message. Optional.
Extra parameters to add to the redirect to Service Provider message. Optional.
member.returns: The pending user agent redirect based message to be sent as an HttpResponse.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.WebConsumer.ProcessUserAuthorization
member.summary: Processes an incoming authorization-granted message from an SP and obtains an access token.
member.returns: The access token, or null if no incoming authorization message was recognized.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.WebConsumer.ProcessUserAuthorization(System.Web.HttpRequestBase)
member.summary: Processes an incoming authorization-granted message from an SP and obtains an access token.
member.param: The incoming HTTP request.
member.returns: The access token, or null if no incoming authorization message was recognized.
